definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: How is discrimination between languages produced in infants?
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒們是擁有對兩種語言的辨別力的？

sentences.english: Discretion in speech is more than eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 演說的辨別力不止是雄辯。

sentences.english: He hasn't enough sense to realize his mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有足夠的辨別力去認識自己的錯誤。

sentences.english: The ability or power to see or make fine distinctions; discernment .
sentences.chinese: 他沒有足夠的辨別力去認識自己的錯誤。
財政管理上辨別力良好。

sentences.english: He has the discrimination in making friends.
sentences.chinese: 在交友方面他有辨別力。

sentences.english: But the relationship between absolute pitch and language cannot be the whole story.
sentences.chinese: 但音高辨別力和語言之間的關係不可能是其原因。

sentences.english: Perhaps a genetic predisposition for absolute pitch is more common among Asian populations.
sentences.chinese: 也許音高辨別力的基因素因在亞洲人中更加普遍。

sentences.english: He is so unrefined as to be lacking in discrimination and sensibility.
sentences.chinese: 他是如此愚鈍，缺乏辨別力和敏感度。

sentences.english: She has a good sense of locality .
sentences.chinese: 她對於方位有很強的辨別力。
